Reviews.Title: “Safe and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: Olivia C
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in December 2010 while I was taking scuba lessons in Playa. Alux was a great little hotel off the main strip, so it's very quiet at night but close enough to the town center that I felt very safe walking back and forth by myself every night. The accommodations were simple and very clean, and a great price! A nice range of restaurants nearby, including a really good hole-in-the-wall steak place around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “1st Stop, Pleasant and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ruthandvern
Reviews.Content: This was actually May 2010, my sister, my husband and I flew into Cancun, and were en route to Sarteneja, Belize. I'd heard so much about Playa we stopped here at Aluz. Reservations were made in advance and the service was excellent. The building was charming, spotless but inviting and it comes with a resident peacock. The hotel is very close to the downtown action with many dining options, great shopping and of course, the beach. Skip Cancun, head south a bit to Playa del carmen, The Alux is a great place to stay, very reasonably priced. Parking available.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget accom, great location”
Reviews.Author: Silverteen
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights and enjoyed everything about this hotel. Its not luxury but has everything you need, great bathroom, tv, air con, nicely decorated and very clean. Its situated about 5 minutes walk to the bus station and only 2 minutes to the 5th avenue street and beach. Not much english spoken at the hotel but we got by fine. free use of water cooler in reception too. there is a fantastic restuarant towards 5ave on the left that has a menu of the day with fantastic service, excellent 3 course menu with wine which works out around £5 a head.... best meal we had in mexico. If your not hung up on luxuries this is the place to stay in playa.

Reviews.Title: “Located near bus station”
Reviews.Author: sunshinekw
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night during our trip to Belize. The place was clean, the beds fairly comfortable. You cannot beat the price!

Reviews.Title: “Best for the Value”
Reviews.Author: YvonneBergeron
Reviews.Content: My Fiance and I stayed for a long weekend in Playa. This hotel is a hidden gem. The price is excellent for the clean rooms and the lovely people who own this charming hotel. It is a few minutes walk to the boardwalk. The air conditioning is wonderful and everything is very clean. I would recommend it to anyone ;) We will be back since this is were we were engaged on a rainy day in playa!

Reviews.Title: “Nice cheap hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jeroen-Leanne
Reviews.Content: nice cheap hotel. Location was perfect and only a few minutes away from the mainstreet and beach. Personnel was friendly, but spoke only spanish. Room were a bit oudated. No breakfast possibility in the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot in Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: Mowiegeoff
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at the Alux Playa hotel and was pleasantly surprised as to both the value and location of the hotel as it's great. We travelled on a budget as we were going south to Belize, but let me assure you if you can get a flight to Cancun and need a base in a great location (Playa del Carmen) then this is the spot for both cost and location as i would give it maximum points on both. The hotel is clean, comfortable and basic and if you bear this in mind you will not be disappoint. The owners/managers were very nice and helpful but spoke very little English. All in all a good value vacation stop if you need a cheap and cheerful spot to rest your weary head

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Budget Hotel Close to 5th Ave”
Reviews.Author: avery755
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for budget reasons and location. It was only a few blocks walking distance to 5th avenue, beaches, nightlife, etc and I felt very safe walking at night alone. The rooms were clean and simple yet charming with mexican flare. The showers always had hot water but it would always overflow onto the bathroom floor. The window air conditioner cooled my room down just fine in 90 degree weather but I like it hot sometimes. The hotel was very quaint and quiet. I would not stay here if you were looking for a very nice hotel as this is a place to crash but comfortable. the beds were hard as most are in Mexico. The staff was friendly but did not speak english very well so when I asked a few questions they had a hard time answering me/ I would stay again if on a budget. At night I had to knock at the front door to get them to let me in. Sometimes it took awhile when it was at 2am but not a big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Close to la playa”
Reviews.Author: TexasTravelerIV
Reviews.Content: Staying at Hotel Alux was a great experience. It is 3 blocks off the beach and super close to restaurants and shopping. I have stayed in Playa del Carmen many times - this was my first time at Alux and it is a great budget hotel. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Can not beat the value”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Yucatan
Reviews.Content: Sweet place in the upper end, happening area of 5th street (it is off 10th but if you want to sleep you need to sleep off 5th). It is right in the middle of all the great places to eat shop and visit and is just $46 dollars a night- tax included! They are very sweet but do not speak English so if you have no Spanish it might be a little tuff but not imposable. It is a family place with the Mom, Daughter and sSn helping you at the front desk. They are sweet honest and friendly. It is a basic place with af ew little details that make it nice. There is a kitchen sink in every room and a little bar to make food and some rooms have kitchens too. It has great air conditioning and wonderful water pressure- which you do not miss unless you go without it. I found that the only thing I needed the room for in the Playa was to shower and cool off which both needs were fulfilled here. Great spot!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, authentic, very clean hotel near all the amenities.”
Reviews.Author: javanee
Reviews.Content: Lovely Mexican hotel full of character. The staff are very helpful though some Spanish is helpful for communication. This hotel is within walking distance to good restaurants, the nightlife and shopping on 5th Avenue, the ferry to Cozumel, Walmart and the wonderful beach. But it's far enough away to be quiet at night. The water cooler with chilled water in the hotel is helpful for filling up your water bottles. A great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great, clean hotel with authentic style.”
Reviews.Author: John_McAllister
Reviews.Content: I loved Hotel Alux. You have incredible bang for your buck and the place looks great too with its authentically Mexican tiled floors and kitchen areas and the exposed beams. Nice Ranchero feel to it. It has a nice courtyard and offers an appreciated silence at the end of the day. The staff as well were lovely and friendly. The bed isn't much to write home about but that's often the case in Mexico so our expectations were low to begin with. The showers were good and always had hot water, and the cleaning staff always did a perfect job. Some people have mentioned their misgivings about alcohol --- the hotel does prohibit alcohol, as the owners do not want it to be a "party hotel" and they want a reliably peaceful stay for their other guests. However if you bring in a few beers and are respectful they are not likely to say anything - this is what we found during our stay. There are no refrigerators in the rooms - what we did was buy a styrofoam cooler from Walmart and we kept our beverages in there. Same goes with beach towels - we just picked up a couple at Wallies and walked down to our favourite place on the beach. Ice is available from most small stores and Oxxos. The value is incredible. I highly recommend this place. We stayed at three different places in PDC (including a beachfront hotel and a 4 star) during our most recent two week stay and for bang for buck no other place came even close.

Reviews.Title: “ideal location, clean, modern rooms, great rates”
Reviews.Author: BeantownTourist
Reviews.Content: This hotel is within walking distance of the beaches, restaurants, and shopping of Playa del Carmen. Its off-the-beach location means a greatly reduced price. We stayed in a room with a simple kitchen, which made it very convenient to do something other than eat out for every meal. We made reservations in advance via email, which was very convenient.. We enjoyed the beach in Playa as well as trips to Tulum and Coba.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfy rooms with everything close by.”
Reviews.Author: Narcd
Reviews.Content: Rooms are clean and reasonable priced. Great location as you are close enough to walk everywhere but just far enough that that it is quiet. I stay here often on my way over to Cozumel or back to the Cancun airport.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Harry0972
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 3 nights, for a promotional price of 400 pesos/night (which was also stated outside). this was excellent value for money as: * the room was very clean, also the bathrooom. * cable tv and airco (actually it was not that hot in playa). * helpfull and friendly staff. *good and save location, 1,5 block from la quinta (5th avenue), in a quiet area. Of course there will be better hotels in playa but not for this prices.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: alisha1980
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just got back from Playa Del Carmen last night and could not have better things to say about this little hotel close to everything in Playa. The room was clean and spacious, and the staff was very friendly and helpful. They didn't speak much english but this didn't prove to be a problem at all. We were always greeted with a smile and were helped quickly with anything we needed. We paid 580 pesos a night, a very good deal for the high season.It was a small hotel that had a feeling of being run by a small family, I would tell my family/friends to stay there for sure.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Alux
HotelInfo.Address: Calle 14 Norte | Entre Avenidas 10 y 15, Playa del Carmen, Mexico
